imdb_user_reviews.contents: An enjoyable animation for adults and kids alike
It's not HTTYD, but it still kicks butt!
one of the best movies i've seen in the past few years or so.
Some villains are born to be heroes.
Megamind is the Charlie Brown of super villains.
A Funny Animation with a Parody to the Origins of Superman and a Satire to Superhero Movies
Different and an entertaining super hero story
Funny enough to keep you watching for more
Where'd you park the invisible car?
A well developed movie for adults and kids
Very good animation movie with story told from antagonist side.
Heros are out, Villains are in
Will Metro City have a new champion?
Sort of like "Despicable Me" but for an older audience...
My mind just went megamind on me!
Twists the idea of what is good and what is evil
Much better than suspected, I had low expectations
Never Thought I Would LOVE This Movie!
Great Movie with Some Clever Twists,
Absolutely amazing - as good as Shrek 1 and a zillion times better than Shrek 2-4
"You know I'm bad, I'm bad come on, you know,And the whole world has to,Answer right now."
Okay movie; definitely for youngsters and not recommended for more mature audiences
Noisy, wild, hyperactive, crazy...  pretty good!
Megamind is a fun and entertaining film that doesn't try to feel or look real
Presentation is all the makes it stand out!
more serious without the cute minions
Megamind, Dreamwork's Own  "Zero To Hero" and I Kinda like it
A sure One time watch. if u haven't seen it, go for it!
great IMAX 3D movie that you can not  miss for sure
Megamind is the Best Animated film since Shrek.
I love it! What else can I say?
Famous voices Animation Superheroes Crazy comedy antics Who could ask for more?
Bring your little middle aged guy!
Megamind could very easily be just another 3D animation film. But it has enough originality to thoroughly entertain any audience!
it didn't suck and I enjoyed it overall
Ferrell's comic talents push this into the positive
Great movie, not just for kids
Not my favourite Dreamworks film, but smart and very entertaining
Can an evil genius turn good?  If you like Will Ferrell you will like this.  I liked it but not for reasons I expected. I say B+
Decent drama and spectacular action animation
An amusing, albeit unspectacular, diversion with a great voice cast.
Do you have to be a super hero to be a "super" hero?
A philosophical Nature VS Nurture debate masquerading as a hilarious kids' movie.
Turning superhero clichés on their heads
IMAX 3D Review: Megamind... will blow your mind!
Quite different from other superhero animations
Blue-skinned, Oz-like Conehead is a non-stop charmer despite presence of mean-spirited Titan antagonist
Hilarious !! / What drives many people to the Evil side ??
"If there's still evil, good will rise up against it"
Decent film but seems to try too hard
Great Film But Not Really For Kids
Fun and frantic sendup of cartoon villains & heroes: SUPERMAN meets THE INCREDIBLES
Good Story, Great Characters, Big Laughs
A good spin on the superhero movies but Tangled FTW
Good Always Triumph even when it's evil
I made you a hero, you did the fool thing ALL BY YOURSELF!
Don't expect The Incredibles, Expect a Will Ferrel movie in CG
A unsuccessful villain defeats his enemy, but then realizes he gets bored without him...
What Shrek was too fairy tales, Megamind is too superheros
Mega Awesome characters- laughs- story. lovely.
A few funny moments don't really make up for its lack of inspiration
Not Even Worth Watching on VHS
Another animated movie on the lines of "Monsters Vs. Aliens", "Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs', "Bolt" and "Despicable Me" which are Colorful but Not Funny AtAll!
Old cliché wrapped in A new layer
the best animated film so far of 2010
Megamind with the voices of Will Ferrell, Tina Fey, and Brad Pitt is a wonderful parody of the superhero genre
Scripted Hollywood checklist pleasure; nothing out of the ordinary
Not exactly original or great, but it's cute and still better and funnier than "Madagascar".
Will Ferrel turns his Mugatu voice into more undeserved $.
Brad Pitt's Voice Work Excellent, but Overall Just Satisfactory
Hang on tight and be prepared for mega fun!
CODE: This movie is totally Awesome!
Not Even Worth Watching on VHS
Another cartoon.  How about a "real" movie?
By far the worst animated movie I ever seen in 2010...
Not a good choice for young girls

mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: Megamind has presentation in spades. But it also has something even rarer than that. It's got heart.
Megamind's Kryptonite is a common weakness for any comedy so fast out of the blocks: It simply runs out of surprises.
There's nothing wrong with animation aimed at adults, but this may be the first kids' movie that throws fewer bones to its supposed intended viewers than to their parents.
Too goofy-surreal to pack a lot of emotional punch, but it's antically light on its feet, with 3-D images that have a lustrous, gizmo-mad sci-fi clarity.
In a family market that's been woefully weak of late, Megamind should not only rescue Metro City but the box office, too.
Visually Megamind is immaculately sleek and gracefully enhanced by 3-D. The score by Hans Zimmer and Lorne Balfe is refreshingly subtle for an action comedy.
Megamind has momentum and dazzle.
Megamind is largely what one might expect from an animated movie featuring a number of notable comedians in voice roles: an amusing diversion.
Megamind, it turns out, is a villain to root for.
The bliss of Megamind is the way it pursues solutions for tired problems.
Megamind is an amusing family entertainment and gains some energy from clever dialogue and the fun Will Ferrell has with his character.
Handsome and generally amusing adventure.

More impressive than the multi-dimensions is Megamind's minimalist, modernist look. It creates a crispness that feels more contemporary than retro, which not only is very aesthetically pleasing but makes it easier to savor the film's many sight gags.
The kiddie set can chortle at Megamind's slapstick and its goofy one-upmanship while adults get a kick out of all the smart spatial tricks that highlight the 3-D effects.
Megamind is snappy good fun.
Megamind gets existential, but only in blips, and while it is never anything less than vibrant and exceedingly clever, it is also a rather slight thing for such mega-sized proportions.
No doubt some of it is charming enough to induce giggles in its preteen target audience.
Tries too hard and ultimately achieves less. It's undone by its own inferiority complex.
The voice casting is on the money and these funny people - and I'm including Pitt, who plays this sort of self-mocking Adonis well, even in animated form - make this cute comedy come off.
Director Tom McGrath keeps the action spinning and trips lightly over the bummer spectacle of watching a bad boy go good.
Moderately funny though immoderately derivative.
This is Ferrell's movie, meaning some inspired laughs sandwiched between annoying bits that stretch on well past their usefulness.
Like his plans, Megamind verges on greatness but has flaws. But it's fun, energetic and at times dazzling. Expect a stronger sequel - unlikely to be 'darker and grittier', though.

Mostly, the jokes and the recurrent attempts to tweak the superhero genre serve as a reminder that somebody else has already done it better. Sure, Megamind is pretty good. But why settle for less when you the best is already available on DVD?

In ingenuity and charm, this DreamWorks offering isn't up there with "Kung Fu Panda," which remains the sharpest, fullest film from the studio. You may get the feeling that Megamind was made for, and possibly by, really smart six-year-olds. Nothing wrong with that; audiences of all ages can be tickled by the higher form of preadolescent humor.
Megamind falls flat.
The plot is rich, the execution poor.
Has some funny moments, silly mispronunciations and comical socio-political references. But it suffers from being the second animated movie this year to feature a dastardly villain for a hero.
A dispiriting return to the tired, star-driven, pop-culture-ridden formula that DreamWorks Animation ran into the ground before its best feature in years, this spring's "How to Train Your Dragon."
Comes off as a derivative wisecracking machine rather than a feat of sustained imagination.
This routine animated feature is a perfectly fine thing to waste.
Plays out like a clunky, not-so-incredible "Incredibles," or a more-despicable "Despicable Me."
If nothing else, I found my son's Kryptonite: boring superhero rip-offs voiced by check-cashing actors. At least Steve Carell used an accent.

mc_user_reviews.text: Not nearly as funny as it should be mostly because of the talented voice cast, or as entertaining, but it brings laughs, originality, and dazzling animation. I give this film 61%.

Great movie for the whole family! Great voices and quite a few twists! Very funny and very happy with the story line and ending, you won't be disappointed. To the critics: who cares if its a Superman sattire? It's a great movie!
Great movie! i especially like the concept of the bad guy wanting to be good. the story is also very good, Will Ferell did a great job in this movie.

I was pleasantly surprised that I actually enjoyed the movie, which is the reason I gave a 7. But technically speaking, the story is incredibly ordinary, the voice acting is average and the whole concept was dull and boring. The scenes of the movie, though, are very funny and a little bit intriguing, which incredibly saved the movie. Not a perfect movie, but it is definitely worth watching for............
Megamind may be somewhat similar to Despicable Me, but it has a lot that makes it more unique. It is a lot more adventurous and daring and it feels like a great comic book story.
I love this movie best kid's film ever, very funny, very entertaining and very good. u will not regret seeing this!!! and it has the very good twist ending!

A city without a hero is indeed a bummer, but for the villain, it could be a catastrophe. Why formulate a nifty plot that will overtake the world if no one out there is good enough to challenge it? Where's the fun in building an enormous, vicious, dancing machine if no man of equal awesomeness will stand up to it? Megamind (Will Ferrell) knows this feeling all too well.

"Megamind" has the "bad guy quality" that has been shown in "Despicable Me", but is able to shine will more clever humor than what "Despicable Me" had to offer. While it does use recycled material (or what seems to be) from "The Incredibles", it still is a somewhat original film with its characters. While no where even close to "The Incredibles", "Megamind" is still enjoyable, and its characters are likable. Its humor and storytelling is not too bad, but still could have been worked on, as sometimes the story feels written by a committee with its overdoing plot points. Despite these flaws, the film is able to work, as its voice work and animation is enjoyable to watch, leaving audiences in for a treat of laughs.
Not as intelligent or even as humorous as it thinks it is, but Megamind stills has plenty of surprising wit and well designed special effects to make it fun entertainment for kids and adults.

The movie is admittedly fun to watch....for the sake of the kids. All those audience critics who are experienced in watching dream works animation will be very familiar with the tedious formula of the 'bad guy becomes good guy after experiencing enlightenment' dream works ALWAYS uses.
This movie was a lot of fun.  Suitable for all ages.  I caught the 3D version, and it was very well done.  Will Farrell was very funny as Megamind.  If you like his comedy, you will like this movie.

This film is definitely worth a watch. The graphics were very good and the story had some fun twists. Unfortunately like all recent disney movies, (except for toy story 3) it lacks the charm that the old disney had.
This movie will leave you scratching your head, asking yourself 'what just happened?'. Will Ferrell at his best! Megamind will blow your mind, and this is no joke!

Soundtrack was great and the movie was a lot of fun.  Many people in the theater laughed out loud throughout the movie and I found myself doing so as well.  It was good but not great.  Don't listen to the haters.  Anyone delving too deep into the plot or character development missed the reason for going to an animated movie in the first place.  The kids enjoyed it and so did I.  Thats all that matters to me.

Nothing special, very mediocre.  It seems as if dreamwoks was always tryng to beat pixar and never succeeded... Even the last shreks were pretty bad. MM can be entertaining... But on a very "theres nothing left to see" way.

In a year (or two) with some great animated films, Megamind is a dive back towards mediocrity. It's along the lines of the majority of other DreamWorks releases, a perfectly fine movie for kids to go see, with a good amount of chuckles but devoid of any kind of creativity or innovation when it comes to audiences over the age of 13. The animation and voice acting are pefectly okay, with Tina Fey being the only real stand out. A good movie for children, it's mildly funny and standard for anyone else.
A very enjoyable movie that turned out to be better than I thought it would, despite the rip off from Superman in the beginning of the movie.

"Megamind is clever & ingenious as it is humorous & fun to watch , Will Ferrell brings his A game in this one of kind heartfelt animated movie .. that will have you laughing , some moments get a little sloppy and predictable at times but its still worth it" .. B+
A supervillain that was never really a bad guy, a super hero that is tired of being good and a dumb superhero that becomes nasty is a messy recipe.  Nevertheless, it was quite enjoyable at times.

Completely unoffensive in its mediocrity, as it provides a few laughs with what it thinks is an atypical story but is ultimately predictable and just another generic Dreamworks animated film. I did have higher hopes for this one though because of the voice cast.

Megamind, a supervillian conquers his nemesis, Metro Man and takes over the city, but gets bored and has no one left to fight. He creates a new foe, Titan, also known as Hal, and teaches him to use his powers for good. Instead, he sets out to destroy the world, and feeling like he has no choice, Megamind must save the day for the first time in his life.
Nine year old daughter says it is the best movie she ever saw!

This movie addresses an interesting question; what defines a super hero?  Or for that matter, what defines a villain?  In Megamind we find Will Farrell playing a super-villain now lacking a hero to match himself against.  In a fit of boredom he attempts to create a different challenge and finds himself defending the city he loves to torment.  This film accomplished something wonderful; it made me feel like a kid again.  I found myself smiling uncontrollably in the climax of the movie and cheering for the good(?) guy as brains clashed against its old time foe, brawn.  A must for anyone that still secretly hopes for super powers, adult or child.

This movie is exactly what you'd expect really, it's very funny in places and the cgi is outstanding, the plot isn't too childish and the characters are pretty funny. DVD Rental: Will Ferrell x The Incredibles = Do It

I have to admit Mega mind was over dramatic. The whole plot kept me sleepy. I cant complain my child loved it but I didn't neither did my husband so needless to say it is not a movie that the whole family can enjoy. There were parts were they were trying to hard to be funny but they were not, i laughed at some parts and some parts tickled my humor but other then that I do recommend this movie for someone with an over active sense of humor. but each opinion is different from one another you might like it and you might not either way the choice is yours

Very disappointed, Will Ferrell is a star not a cartoon voice. I wanted to see this movie so bad but the plot disappointed me so bad, who wants to see the villain become good I thought Brad Pitt was going to make a comeback and save the world. Great idea with the twist but didn't work as a kids movie. I will say that there some really funny parts but wasn't worth the time.
A mediocre, borderline bad movie.

What a bore. Virtually no laughs throughout the whole movie. The 3D was non-existant, the plot was unoriginal, and the trailer literally gave everything away. After seeing what Dreamworks was capable of with "How to Train Your Dragon", this is beyond disappointing.

This movie is a disaster.  Utterly charmless, it was the first time I was really aware of the difference between a star, and Voice Actor.  As funny as Ferrell & Fey can be, vocally they are not interesting.  I miss Paul Frees, Hans Conried and the rest of that generation.  And I was born well after they did their work.  Avoid this movie.

The movie is a rehash of screen-bytes from several other movies, strung together in a pastiche of cliches. The move seemed unable to decide who was a good person and who was  a bad person. The writers present the idea that  by pretending to be someone you are not,  you can win genuine love and become an admirable person. The movie seems wish us to believe that, when the lie is revealed,  the liar becomes a hero. The plot couldn't seem to decide who the intended audience was... one minute it was frenetic smash 'em up cartoon violence, and the next morose existential self-loathing recriminations that seemed to  bore the entire audience. The color in the 3D version was exceptionally poor -  weak and watery.  We love good animated films, such as Toy Story, Monsters Inc., and Despicable Me. Sadly, Megamind is more mindless than entertaining.

I'm an adult now (18 years old) so I thought this might be a bit "kiddish" and predictable. However, I ended up grinning and laughing throughout the movie, even though it didn't have a complicated plot or anything. The characters were lovable, dynamic, and hilarious in their own respects! I would recommend this movie for anyone regardless of age, it is also definitely a feel-good movie.
I thought this movie was funny but I was surprised that it had heart. It was really sad. Will Ferrell's voice is all you need for a movie to be funny. It also has a great soundtrack.

Entertaining and visually well crafted animated feature.  Yet another movie that did not need to be in 3D, though I saw it that way.  Brad Pitt seems to be doing an impression of his friend George Clooney, but is out of the movie so early it doesn't really matter.  Will Ferrell does a nice job.  The bad guy becoming a good guy angle is cute too.  But for those 8-9-10 reviews, did you give Toy Story 3 a 14?  This is cute and has a nice message, but it is not even close to any of the TS films.  Rating inflation in movies is just like grade inflation in school, everything is not a 10.
Beautiful 3-d animation, cool action sequences and decent plot oddly missing humor. There are some chuckles, but bad drama isn't fun in a kid flick.
Megamind is a great movie and I thought it was something new and creative.

The hugely entertaining new movie of stars is Megamind, which contains a very surprisingly unpredictable plot, unusual for any other superhero movie: Villain tries to thwart hero, hero beats villain, villain is defeated, hero saves the day, blah, blah, blah. But this film went much deeper than that, with the would-be-villain wanting to be the hero at the ending, & not being too much of a bad guy, after all. With a smart & fresh sense of cool comedy to add to this, Megamind is surely something you will not want to miss.

While this film isn't quite perfect, it is close enough that you don't even care. I was pleasantly suprised with the outcome. The characters are well written, and stick to themselves, and act as they should in the heat of the moment, unlike the majority of kids charavters these days. The imagery, while not as whimsical or colorful as Tangled, but it fits. Facial expressions and weather effects are spot on. My one complaint is to have more Minion! He is the real star here!
I really enjoyed this movie. Though the relationship between Megamind and minion was kinda creepy, like a mother son thing. The scenes from the school were totally funny though!

With an easy blend of comedy and action, Megamind doesn't stand out as one of the animation of the year. But it does however, convince its audience that they will like it coming out of the theater. It is not as slick as The Incredibles and the 3D scenes aren't amazing as How to Train Your Dragon, but you'll enjoy it. Megamind is about a supervillain and a superhero battling since they were born. Megamind, a blue guy with a big head, spends his whole life trying to kill Metroman (Brad Pitt). While the city hates him, he's convince that when he kills Metroman, the citizens will obey him. But when he finally "killed" Metroman, he found out that his life no longer has a purpose. He has nothing else to do rather than stealing stuff from the city. At this point, I think the movie is trying to get out the message that you have to live life with a purpose, or something like that. But in the end, we know Metroman is alive and Megamind gets locked up again. (There is a whole other subplot that's I'm not going to get in.) Will Ferrell's voice as Megamind is irrepleacable but Tina Fey and Brad Pitt were just unnessecary. Jonah Hill was way better than the two combined but that was because he was one of the big character. They tried to do a lot of stuff in 3D that weren't suppose to work in 3D. But at least they tried. 3-dimensional effects isn't that hard, but I felt like it took them forever in this film and get those effects going. Megamind isn't bad, it is great to say the least. But it lies between the it's-so-bad-that-it's-good type of movie.

My brother boldly declared "Mega Mind was mega stupid!" after seeing it. I would not go as far as he did with his statement, but I did feel that it was a mediocre effort by the filmmakers. Will Ferrell is hilarious as an actor, but as a cartoon voice we are left without his facial expressions and body language which always lend to his humor. The opening sequence was probably the funniest portion of the movie before we settle into another story of a bad guy who realizes he isn't so bad after all (Despicable Me?). You will get a few laughs from this movie, but do not go into it expecting to see a Shrek (the first one) or Toy Story quality story.
Megamind sadly does not redeem Will Farrel, it's just a mediocre movie about redemption, I give it credit for trying to teach you something and being unique, but it doesn't save it from mediocrity.

The movie is BRILLIANT! I am a guy who doesn't visit big screens much at all but I saw this one TWICE! The stereoscopy was brilliant! The background score,facial acting(animation),the characters everything was SUPER AMAZING! This movie (in 3d) is seriously like a ride which you would like to ride on again and again,irrespective of its story,because any UBER FUN ride doesn't require a story anyways.People might have totally opposite reviews regarding the story but I loved it as the FUN totally synchronized with how the movie progressed.Its a must see for all ages.Enjoy the super EVIL Megamind!
Will Ferrell fan here:) Everything he does is just awesome, but animation is superb, sound great, story fun, really suitable for all generations. Action packed comedy with great plot!

This movie is hilarious! Will Ferrell is hilarious, and I'm being serious! I don't think he has been this funny since Elf as far as his cleaner films go; if you like some of his raunchier films then you might disagree with me on that. But in all seriousness, the humour is pretty off the wall and fast paced; the off the wall description might not be all that descriptive, but the lines are like, "Okay now let's continue with some witty banter, you first.....Ahhhhhh!.....Hmmmm, I don't really know where to go with that". Basically it's a fun film, what might look like a lesser comedy/animated flick is suprisingly clever and worth the $19.99 I spent to buy it when all the other copies were rented out at all the Redboxes and Blockbusters (and when I say Blockbusters, I mean Blockbuster). So, to sum it up: Overall: It is a funny Will Ferrell movie, not THE funniest comedy ever or anything, but it made me laugh and my taste in humour is along the lines of Monty Python and Bill Murray; hope that helps. Signature 9/10 SS

Will Ferrell shows his genius once more in the film, everything about his character is engaging, funny and then funny some more. The film is beautifully put together with awesome visuals and an awesome soundtrack too.  Watched it with my two year old son who was laughing throughout, although I think he was laughing at me laughing at the film... even so, we were both in stitches!

This movie was great I had a lot of fun with it!!! In my opinion it's a instant classic and I hope they make a second part and dnt give me the mediocre crap this movie was funny and well worth watching and owning on DVD! Some people just need a sence of humor

I think one word could describe how I felt after watching this movie, and it is surprise! I was not expecting anything too fantastic when I sat down to watch it, but as it finished I found myself pleased and I even had some laughs along the way! The plot was more developed then I was expecting, which is probably the reason I enjoyed the movie so much. The characters develop well, and I really enjoyed this one, check it out sometime!

You won't even know it's Will Ferrel! He's so good in this, so funny, too! This movie had a perfect story line with cool characters. The animation's good, too. I love this movie and highly recommend it!!!!!!!!
Yes, Another Superhero/Animated Movie. There Were Many Where This Came From At Disney. After They Progressed, They Got Worse And Worse Until They Stopped. Why? Because Of This Movie.

When i first heard about this, and saw the trailers, i was excited and i wanted to see it so badly. I got it when it came to dvd, and it was horrible. Their was a few laughs here and there, but nothing really that funny. It had a pretty bad plot, and the ending just sucked. Who turns the villain into a hero? turning a villain into a hero is the most stupidest thing to do. And he finished the hero too quickly. overall this movie was overrated. PIPEBOMB!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Too bad for Hal(Jonah Hill) that the laws of physics prevent him from having an unlimited amount of do-overs, since his courting of Roxanne Ritchie(Tina Fey), a reporter who covers the Metro Man beat, theoretically, would have taken an almost infinite amount of trial runs in order for the desired love connection he covets, to come about. When Megamind(Will Ferrell) turns the cameraman into Tighten, one chance is all the newly-minted superhero has to woo the Lois Lane-esque reporter, but he blows it, in spite of all the years he spent observing Metro Man through his lens, and that's because the superhero persona he cops isn't an organic extension to his natural make-up. Neither heroic, nor romantic, characteristics that mortal men possess too, Hal becomes enraged and confused when Roxanne rebuffs his overtures for love, even as Tighten, because he thought the cape was the key to her heart. If only it was "Groundhog Day". In the Harold Ramis film, the laws of physics pull a fast one on Rita(Andie McDowell), the segment producer on the Punxsutaney Phil shoot, who falls for weatherman Phil Connors(Bill Murray) without ever realizing that her heart was won over through trial and error, a time loop perpetuated by an omniscient narrator with the powers of a superhero. Phil's subconscious, perhaps, was the one who messed with the space-time continuum, since time doesn't move forward until the misanthropic journalist wins Rita over. If only Hal knew that Roxanne and Metro Man(Brad Pitt) were not an item. As Tighten, he tries to impress Roxanne by showing her the city from the sky, but his attempt at romantic spontaneity comes across as rehearsed, especially when Hal drops his captive audience of one in mid-air because it's what he thinks Metro Man would do. Unfortunately, Roxanne comes closer to dying than falling in love. His forced stab at creating a backdrop for romance has the same forced tenor as the scene in "Groundhog Day", in which Phil, portraying himself as future husband material, ends up scaring away some local kids from constructing a snowman with the grown-ups. It worked once, and Rita swoons a bit, but the second time around fails, as his every word suddenly becomes weighty with self-consciousness, giving his voice an off-kilter timbre that ends up scaring both the children and woman. Whereas the potentiality of that snowman being built was always a reasonable proposition because of Phil's relative humanity, Hal, on the other hand, could spend an eternity aping Metro Man, flying his brains out with Roxanne in tow, night after night, and never getting anywhere near his objective. Tighten has superpowers, but he doesn't know how to use them. He just isn't the Metro Man type, and worse yet, the disgruntled superhero abuses his gifts, when he threatens Roxanne(and the Metro City denizens) after she declines to reciprocate his show of ardor. He's pure evil, unlike Megamind, who is like one of the famous international playboys, the last, that Morrissey sings about, because the blue man is "not naturally evil"; his plot to kill Metro Man was only a ploy to "make [him]self more attractive to [Roxanne]," and when it doesn't, the moviegoer knows how deep the blue runs. Unlike Tighten, Phil is Superman in the sense that he puts his immortality at risk by committing suicide on a daily basis, never knowing if his latest attempt will become his last. In Richard Donner's "Superman II", Superman knowingly exposes himself to Kryptonite, in the form of harnessed red rays, as he steps into the crystal chamber, where he could easily die, as the Man of Steel tests his invincibility out of love for a woman, just like Phil, an ordinary man who does an extraordinary thing. By killing himself, Phil explores the possibility that his own death may be the key to freeing Rita and his smart-alec cameraman from the time loop. Hal would never make that sort of sacrifice. Unlike Lois Lane, who loves Superman, and not his alter-ego Clark Kent, Roxanne's taste in men is much more idiosyncratic; she kisses Bernard(Ben Stiller), Megamind's alter-ego, not Metro Man, the man Hal aspires to be, because being the protector of man was never supposed to be the megalomaniacal superhero's gig either. And when Megamind accidentally reveals his true identity in the middle of that kiss, a great wrong is finally righted. Roxanne is kissing the real hero. The alien babies ended up with the wrong lives, the wrong destinies. Since apathy can be a form of treachery, Metro Man's willingness to leave mankind unprotected makes him a villain, in some ways, far worse than Megamind ever was.

Megamind is a pretty good film that has a charming story with great dialogue for the spoof superhero. Will Ferrell is funny as Megamind,he's a likable supervillian that he's cool and funny. The characters are good,Brad Pitt as Metroman,Tina Fey as Roxanne Ritchi,she's mixed between Lois Lane and April O'Neal,and many more to come. The scenes are good and the setting is like movie between Superman and The Incredibles. Will Ferrell delivers a great character that he's not a bad guy,but he is a lovable supervillain more like Gru from "Despicable Me" that's he's mysterious and kind to other people. Megamind is cool superhero film,but I only see it in 2D,because the 3D wasn't much fun,you could probably avoid 3D while your watching a movie in 2D.

When I first saw the trailer for Megamind I thought to myself this looks pretty funny. When the movie started up I thought to myself this might be ok. After sitting through Megmanid let me tell that this is how you make a good movie.

This animated comedy delightfully channels Will Ferrell's personality, as the villain who terrorizes the city (and mispronounces it). Add Brad Pitt as the swaggering superhero and Tina Fey as the girl in the middle and you've got a strong cast. However, this isn't really one for kids: it's got the required ironic dialogue (much of it funny) and pop culture references. What is doesn't have is any visual surprises (although it's attractive), appealing supporting characters or a decent story (this one's sappy and trite). Still, it's fun to get inside this mind.
The voice performances by Farrell, Fey, Hill, and Pitt along with the scripts witty humor makes up for a lot of this films flaws. In the end, this has got a nice childrenâ

Some of these critics (especially makrtik2) Don't get the movie, because it is told from the side of a 'bad-guy' who , like most 'bad' people... are a product of society.  It's a good story in the sense that it conveys the message that you don't have to live the life that was chosen for you, but rather to pave your own way.

This movie was surprising ! The first time I saw the trailer, I was saying to myself  "This movie looks ridiculous". But I was wrong. It was a AWESOME movie ! The cast did a great job, the plot is fantastic, it was hilarious, the songs in the movie were sick (AC/DC) and the 3D effects are cool. It's a must see movie !

Don't get me wrong. This movie is great fun. But it's development is unorthodox and predictable, and it's characters felt like they were pulled out of a Happy Meal. Its one-stop, witty joke-filled script is hard to take seriously, let alone hard to laugh at for more than two seconds. And its pro-con conflict isn't very convincing, either. But if your version of a good time is a silly, hectic adventure through ridiculous situations with uncommon characters, this movie will knock your socks off.

Quite nice, every parts, the animations, and what I care the most, the history ! Wich fits quite well, and lets us take a lesson from it, Megamind was the movie that got my full attention, it's simply a Super Villain & Super Hero movie like I never seen before, with a completely different structure.

it is a good movie i think animations have really shown them self over the years there are more animations and better animations. Great cast i think they all did a good job working on this movie both i think these movies can be a great evolution in the movie industry the movie industry has changed over the past years movie's have been rude and crude, but i think this kind of movie's could really change or history. I'm not saying every movie has to be a children's movie but i am still saying movie's could tune down their profanity
This is a perfect kid movie very enjojable.

This movie was more enjoyable then I thought, and a more star studded cast then I had originally expected. But my favourite voice actor in this film by far was David Cross as Minion, he has such a distinctive voice but it works so well as the tiny fish with a oversized robot body. I thought that Metro Mans voice would of been great if done by Patrick Warburton but Brad Pitt still does an acceptional job. I give this film 6.5 out of 10.
Children's films can be magical and pull you into a surreal world. Megamind is nothing of the sort, just a silly film with the occasional joke slipped in for the adults.
Boasting spectacular animation and a handful of great vocal performances, this snarky reimagining of the Superman/Lex dynamic ultimately wins over its audience.

"Megamind" is a movie that's funny, entertaining, and heartwarming, combined with a unique setting and extremely well voiced characters that were likeable and wanaged to be memorable without ever feeling forced. One of the best animated movies in recent memory.

It's sad how these movies are constantly making the money. And it's a copycat of Despicable Me, which actually is funny. The voices are well suited, but the parody in this film falls flat rather quickly. Animation has become quite stale, in my opinion.
Megamind is a perfectly enjoyable movie that both kids and adults will enjoy. Will Ferrell is actually hilarious in this one, even if its not his usually movie filled with sexual humor and slapstick.

To my (pleasent) surprise, Megamind was a pretty good film. I was expecting a predictable, charmless animated film the ended up being a wasted potential. But I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. It had more laughs then How to Train Your Dragon, great characters and a lot more heart than most animated films. Although at first the movie feels like it's setting up to be just another fun childrens' film, but it soon raises above them, and helps to keep Dreamworks on the map. Megamind starts safe, but ends brave.

DreamWorks knows how to keep the same approach going, don't they? "Kung Fu Panda" was super dramatic and story-based? Back to the spoof with "Monsters vs. Aliens!" "How to Train Your Dragon" was super dramatic and story-based? Back to the spoof with "Megamind!" What's even more strange is that DreamWorks decided to release a superhero movie spoof centered around a villain not even 4 months after "Despicable Me" was released. Nonetheless, "Megamind," despite having a lot of things working against it, is actually a pretty good animated film. It's pretty funny, it's very well-acted, and it's gorgeous to look at. And even though the plot is nothing you haven't seen before, it's still charming enough thanks to the wonderful characters. It won't win any awards or break any records, but when all is said and done, "Megamind" is a considerably entertaining animated film that's fun for the whole family.
Great movie and funny! very good voice performances of brad pitt, will ferrel and tina fey ,great animation and nice characters, also the history is nothing from another world but its nice.

When I first saw an advertisement for this film back when it came out, I thought "oh great, another one of those stupid animated cash-cow films" but boy was I proven wrong. When I first saw this film, I was pretty surprised at how creative the story was; in theory, when you first here what the story is, you will probably think it's pretty generic, but this film has a lot of creativity to it combining it's superhero/super villain genre with comedic elements; there are even a few pop culture references to this film like Superman and Donkey Kong and probably a few others. Dreamworks did a fine job with this film and I take back anything I said about this film when I saw the teaser back in the day.

Megamind offers some good characters and great animation. I know that it is similar to Despicable Me but I think it is just different enough to stand on its own. I love all the voice talent, most of all Will Ferrell who actually becomes Megamind in this film. The film is maybe a little predictable which is unfortunate. This movie also could've been funnier but overall I think it is a good watch for children who will have lots of fun with it.

A decent effort from DreamWorks Animation with cool fight scenes, interesting story, and a similar back story, it almost feels like Superman. The movie holds up pretty well and does a good job for what it's doing. It's no The Incredibles, but a decent effort.

Amazing Dreamworks Animation movie had me entertained and laughing throughout. The main reason I gave this a 9 was because it was so predictable of who the final villian was, but how the film ended was a total different story. Megamind is pretty cool, and Metroman is too. It's kind of hard to choose which side you are on because both are just so cool. The film is pretty much your good vs. bad guy film, but on the way, there's a lot of surprises.

Very good movie from DreamWorks on an ugly blue villain , big head and is declared as a villain , now a hero when Metro Man killed angering her fan , and caused the act of heroism Megamind , what the hell were the script as purchased ?

Its source feels like a Despicable Me copy only with a couple of differences, but Megamind is once again another enjoyment from Dreamworks Animation and its clever story will keep you interested in the movie.
Megamind is indeed a mega movie. It has a fun cast with a funny, and a pretty likeable story. Its also got that feel like despicable me, but thats not too bad.

Mega mind is very predictable, has boring some kind of boring story-telling and simple characters. This is just another film on cinema history a, with nothing special, despite the inventive plot that started it.
